summary: Xenoblade Developer Monolith Soft Shares Recruitment Message
title: Xenoblade Developer Monolith Soft Shares Recruitment Message
body:
Xenoblade Developer Monolith Soft Shares Recruitment Message

Xenoblade Chronicles developer Monolith Soft is currently on a recruitment drive for their next project which is unknown at this point in time. Tetsuya Takahashi, the boss of Monolith Soft, has revealed that the team is looking for a variety of programmers, planners, artists, designers, and management. Here’s part of the message he shared:

“I’d like to extend a particularly big invitation to…

summary: Believe it or not, Mom used to love playing Nintendo Video Games.  Among her favorites were Bubble Bobble, Dr. Mario, The Legend...
body:
Believe it or not, Mom used to love playing Nintendo Video Games. Among her favorites were Bubble Bobble, Dr. Mario, The Legend of Zelda, Simons Quest, Shadowgate, Willow and Faxanadu. My Mother, Aunt Louise and I loved the Role Playing Stuff bc it forced us to brainstorm. 😊 pic.twitter.com/wWbhWPIDm9

— 80sThen80sNow (@80sThen80sNow) October 13, 2018

reblog.comment:

— 80sThen80sNow (@80sThen80sNow) October 13, 2018

— 80sThen80sNow (@80sThen80sNow) October 13, 2018
trail.content:
Believe it or not, Mom used to love playing Nintendo Video Games. Among her favorites were Bubble Bobble, Dr. Mario, The Legend of Zelda, Simons Quest, Shadowgate, Willow and Faxanadu. My Mother, Aunt Louise and I loved the Role Playing Stuff bc it forced us to brainstorm. 😊 pic.twitter.com/wWbhWPIDm9

— 80sThen80sNow (@80sThen80sNow)

October 13, 2018

summary: Is it me or Blade Strangers is extremely easy and there appears to be no challenge what so ever. Now I know I only played...
caption:
Is it me or Blade Strangers is extremely easy and there appears to be no challenge what so ever. Now I know I only played through the game with one character but it still was way to easy to beat and I didn’t see any difficulty setting. I played Blade Strangers on the Nintendo Switch with the 8bitdo N30 arcade stick and it was a blast to play. The 8Bitdo N30 arcade stick has a solid build with the side and bottom constructed of metal. The arcade stick works fine but the buttons could use a little more spring in their step! 

Get It On The Nitnedo Switch: https://amzn.to/2zAm0L1

8bitdo N30 Arcade Stick: https://amzn.to/2xT3qLR

blog.name: acaddicts
blog.title: Animal Crossing Addicts
blog.description: Welcome to AC Addicts! We hope you enjoy it here!

summary: Let’s talk about “Dead Spots”! 🌲 ◌ For a long time there has been discussions whether towns have the so called “dead spots”...
caption:
Let’s talk about “Dead Spots”! 🌲

◌ For a long time there has been discussions whether towns have the so called “dead spots” (spots in which shrubs and plants/trees can’t grow).

◌ This is false, there’s no dead spots in New Leaf. If there was, hackers wouldn’t be able to place trees there in the Save Editor.

❓So why won’t my tree or bush grow?
🌀Bushes won’t grow if there is more than 12 trees/bushes in a row within a 7x7 square (3 tiles in each direction).
🌀You have planted pine trees on the southern part of the map. Pine trees only grow on the north parts. A good way to know if you’re far enough North, is use the arrow in the middle of your map as a guide!
🌀The item you planted was too close to the cliff, a building or the river, where it’s not natural for it to grow. If it’s too close to a building, it won’t get any sunlight.

◌ Dead spots are only a myth. Sometimes it takes several tries, but remember, without hacking you cannot place lots of bushes in a row, one or more of them will die!

-Info Support ❥

◌ Dead spots are only a myth. Sometimes it takes several tries, but remember, without hacking you cannot place lots of bushes in a row, one or more of them will die!

-Info Support ❥
trail.content:
Let’s talk about “Dead Spots”! 🌲

◌ For a long time there has been discussions whether towns have the so called “dead spots” (spots in which shrubs and plants/trees can’t grow).

◌ This is false, there’s no dead spots in New Leaf. If there was, hackers wouldn’t be able to place trees there in the Save Editor.

❓So why won’t my tree or bush grow?
🌀Bushes won’t grow if there is more than 12 trees/bushes in a row within a 7x7 square (3 tiles in each direction).
🌀You have planted pine trees on the southern part of the map. Pine trees only grow on the north parts. A good way to know if you’re far enough North, is use the arrow in the middle of your map as a guide!
🌀The item you planted was too close to the cliff, a building or the river, where it’s not natural for it to grow. If it’s too close to a building, it won’t get any sunlight.

◌ Dead spots are only a myth. Sometimes it takes several tries, but remember, without hacking you cannot place lots of bushes in a row, one or more of them will die!

-Info Support ❥

summary: Our Review Of Super Mario Party For The Nintendo Switch
title: Our Review Of Super Mario Party For The Nintendo Switch
body:
#SuperMarioParty continues to be an awesomely nostalgic video game with updated mini games!

Our first impressions for Nintendo’s newest couch coop dream, Super Mario Party, were glowing. Having played through the game countless times since it’s fair to say our impressions have continued to remain positive. 

Let’s break down what we liked and didn’t like about Nintendo’s latest party game (read: friendship-ruiner in a cartridge):

Liked: Minigames Image via Super Mario Party screenshots…
